TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed ComInterfaceType extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Identifies how to expose an interface to COM.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This enumeration works in conjunction with the <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.InterfaceTypeAttribute> attribute.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComInterfaceType InterfaceIsDual = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Indicates that the interface is exposed to COM as a [dual interface](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/1d39d64c-e23a-4249-a167-4369d5bd2b65), which enables both early and late binding. InterfaceIsDual is the default value.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComInterfaceType InterfaceIsIDispatch = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Indicates that an interface is exposed to COM as a [dispinterface](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/e8c18ae5-3d9e-4dff-aa20-b5acc723eacf), which enables late binding only.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComInterfaceType InterfaceIsIInspectable = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Indicates that an interface is exposed to COM as a [!INCLUDE[wrt](~/add/includes/wrt-md.md)] interface.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComInterfaceType InterfaceIsIUnknown = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Indicates that an interface is exposed to COM as an interface that is derived from [IUnknown](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=148003), which enables only early binding.
